definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear

sentences.english: Melva kisses another guy in front of her boyfriend justifying it to herself as an eye for an eye.
sentences.chinese: 梅尔瓦在男友面前亲吻另一个男孩，自以为报复。

sentences.english: The wedding kiss is the sign of the holy pledge between the bride and the groom.
sentences.chinese: 婚礼上的亲吻标志着新郎新娘间的神圣誓约。

sentences.english: Kiss the sky --- Zhang said after.
Joyfully, he embraced and kissed his parents and Aksah.
sentences.chinese: 他开心地拥抱，亲吻他的父母，还有阿克萨。
我可是亲吻过不下于20个女孩的。

sentences.english: He kissed her again and she changed back into his pretty little daughter.
sentences.chinese: 他又亲吻了她一下，他美丽的小女儿就变回来了。

sentences.english: She not only can be embosomed but also can be kissed seethingly as much as you like.
sentences.chinese: 不但可以紧拥入怀，还可以尽情亲吻。

sentences.english: His spiritual depression came to an end when she kissed him.
sentences.chinese: 她的亲吻扫除了他精神上的苦闷。

sentences.english: Love begins with a smile, grows with a kiss and ends witha tear.
sentences.chinese: 爱其于微笑，随着亲吻而愈浓，并逝于眼泪。

sentences.english: June 12, Cuba's Luo Bosi kiss trophy celebration.
sentences.chinese: 6月12日，古巴选手罗伯斯亲吻奖杯庆祝。

sentences.english: She is an affectionate child and loves to be hugged and kissed.
sentences.chinese: 她是一个多情的孩子，喜欢让人爱抚亲吻。

sentences.english: Greetings involving kissing caused me to wince, and hugging generally just made me feel awkward.
sentences.chinese: 寒暄时的亲吻让我畏缩，而拥抱则会使我陷入尴尬。

sentences.english: Mother and Sue kissed Gretel goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 母亲和苏与格莱托亲吻道别。

sentences.english: The waves will stand a-tiptoe to kiss your neck and whisper in your ears.
sentences.chinese: 波浪踮着脚尖亲吻你的颈脖，在你耳旁呢喃。

sentences.english: The maximum capacity at the Kiss Nightclub in Santa Maria is 1000 people.
sentences.chinese: 圣玛丽亚的亲吻夜总会最多能容纳1000人。

definition: to caress/to fondle/to look after (tenderly)/affectionate care
to gently caress and stroke/to pet/to fondle
to nestle against/to snuggle up to
to provoke/to entice/to lure/to tantalize/to tease/to titillate
lit. heads rubbing together (idiom)/fig. very close relationship
to hold in one's arms/to embrace
